oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Carte de visite of Henry Sheffield in his Masonic Knights Templar uniform
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Henry Sheffield was a Connecticut-born doctor of homeopathic medicine who settled in Nashville, Tenn. During the Civil War, he was in charge of a ward at the Military Railroad Hospital. He was a Grand Captain General and a Commander in the Nashville; Commandery of the Knights Templar, and is pictured here wearing a Masonic Knights Templar uniform, with a skull and cross on the table beside him. The reverse side bears the stamp of C. C. Giers, Artist, from Nashville, Tenn.
